intro: Uniyala ramaswamii, commonly known as the Madras thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in dry, tropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and scrublands. Uniyala ramaswamii is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional Ayurvedic practices.
